intro: Sulcorebutia fidaiana, commonly known as the Fidaiana stonecabbage, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to arid regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its compact, low-growing structure with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Sulcorebutia fidaiana is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
